Basic details: John Smith, a 49-year-old male, comes to the clinic complaining of back pain.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.7°F (37.1°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sitting on the examination table, leaning forward slightly to relieve discomfort.
Rubbing lower back with one hand.
Exhibiting a grimace when asked to change positions.
If the examinee mentions imaging studies, ask, 'What imaging are you considering for back pain?'
Challenging question: 'Could this be something serious like cancer or a fracture? What should I do next?'
